title: Total U.S. hay production 2000 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Production in thousand tons, with a total of 20 data points. The chart has 8 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly positive which exists from 2008 to 2012.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2016 to 2019.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2000 to 2002.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2002 to 2004.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2004 to 2006.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2006 to 2008.
Also, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2012 to 2014.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2014 to 2016.
gold: This statistic shows the total hay production in the United States from 2000 to 2019 . According to the report , approximately 123.6 million tons of hay were produced in the country in 2018 .
